### Access Permissions in Purview #### Overview - **Privileged Access Management**: Core feature to regulate administrative access. - **Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)**: Assigns specific roles and permissions based on user needs. - **Granular Access Control**: Utilizes fine-grained policies to secure data access. #### Implementation - **User Role Definition**: Establishes various user categories such as admins, readers, and contributors. - **Policy Creation**: Policies to manage and restrict access based on metadata attributes. - **Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC)**: Uses user attributes for dynamic access decisions. #### Practices - **Auditing**: Continuous monitoring of access activities for security. - **Compliance**: Ensures adherence to regulatory requirements. - **Least Privilege Principle**: Grants only necessary access rights to users. #### Tools & Resources - **Azure Active Directory**: Integration for streamlined user management. - **Access Reviews**: Periodic evaluations to validate permissions authenticity. - **Logging and Alerting**: Establishes notification protocols for unauthorized access. #### Security Enhancements - **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: Adds extra security layers to protect sensitive data. - **Conditional Access**: Implements policies based on real-time conditions. - **Access Expiry**: Assigns time-bound access to temporary roles. #### Best Practices - **Regular Updates**: Keeps access policies up-to-date with latest security standards. - **User Training**: Educates users on responsible access handling. -
